类型: Size: 14 Wide Women/13 Wide MenColor: Dark Grey
评论详情: These are our second pair! My son has large very wide feet. Trying to find shoes he likes and are comfortable for him is a struggle every time. These shoes are perfect for him. He uses these for wrestling practice. So, he's running, stretching, sparring, doing all the high school wrestling things in these shoes. They have held up very well compared to some other more expensive brands we've bought. Most others fall apart after about 2 months of use. Mainly the glue or stitching around the sole of shoes just don't hold up to the abuse he puts them through. These shoes have been through creeks and mud, snow and ice, wrestling exercises, the washing machine, anything you can think of a 15 year old boy doing, these shoes have been through it and are 100% intact. His favorite things about them is the room his toes have and they're lightweight. My favorite part is I can throw them in the washer in a laundry bag. I absolutely recommend these to anyone with a larger, wider, flatter foot.
These are by far the most decent barefoot shoes I’ve worn. I am happy with my purchase.

类型: Size: 12 Wide Women/11 Wide MenColor: Black/Gum
评论详情: I have tried the minimalist gig before.  Toe shoes.  I learned to hate them.  Getting them on could be a pain in the duff, over priced, they made my feet itch, running outside meant stepping on rocks, and over time, my feet hurt.  So back to regular shoes.  I liked the idea of toe shoes.  I would not say they were a total wash, but just not for me.  A couple of months back I saw a Hobibear ad on social media.  I clicked.  For the price I figured:  Why not?  I am glad I did.  They comfortable.  The bigger toe box makes me feel like I am walking in swim fins occasionally, but it works itself out.  The toe box allows my toes to stretch out, and more comfort.  I used to have to wear slippers at work because regular shoes were so uncomfortable.  Now I just wear my Hobibears.  I live in the Inter-Mountain West.  We get nasty weather.  The Hobies work well in snow and ice.  At the same time they can be worn in the work setting, church, semi formal events, you do not look like you are dressing down.  I recommend the Hobibears.

The laces are nice, but the shoe fits so good that I didnt even tie them tight. Toe box has plenty of room, and this is a true zero drop AND zero drop insole.  Would definitely recommend these to barefooters, and if you are new to this trend, then go slow at first.

But overall I feel better.  Well worth the experiment.  It's like most things in life you have to stick with these shoes to get the benefit.  Lots of Toe space.  I've had bunions and hammer toes all of my adult life from wearing pointy High Heels, these shoes do not irritate.  Not the prettiest shoes, but just the comfort I needed.

They "skin" of the shoe is a mesh all around the shoe which lends to comfort, freshness and cooler feet. The sole does remind me of the older rubber used many years ago. The overall bottoms are thin which reflect the earth shoe vibe.  But the best part is that these really do fit my wide feet!!!
